docs.snippet: The N.F.L. is increasingly being forced to confront how to make football safer, essentially worrying the same audience that it is seeking to assure....
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. is increasingly being forced to confront how to make football safer, essentially worrying the same audience that it is seeking to assure.
docs.abstract: Officials for the NFL are increasingly confronting how to make football safer, while still retaining the speed, power and violence that make sport so appealing; in doing so, league is risking alarming athletes, their families and fans; dynamic is also sending shock waves through youth sports world.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and KEN BELSON

docs.snippet: The White House conference on sports-related concussions, while a big step in the fight for awareness, came too late for many athletes....
docs.lead_paragraph: The White House conference on sports-related concussions, while a big step in the fight for awareness, came too late for many athletes.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column contends that White House conference on sports-related concussions, while a big step in the fight for awareness, came too late for many athletes; notes that countless players are battling brain injuries, among them Football Hall of Famers like Mike Webster, Harry Carson and Rayfield Wright, all of whom did not know that risks of the game when they played.

headline.main: Obama’s Conference on Concussions Was Too Long in Coming
headline.print_headline: A Meeting Too Long in Coming

docs.snippet: The national team of Palestine faces the Philippines in the final of the Asian Football Confederation Challenge Cup in the Maldives on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The national team of Palestine faces the Philippines in the final of the Asian Football Confederation Challenge Cup in the Maldives on Friday.
docs.abstract: Palestine's national soccer team is preparing to face Philippines in final of Asian Football Confederation Challenge Cup; not only is match team's first final in its 16-year history, but a victory would also mean a place in 2015 Asian Cup, continent's equivalent of European Championship or Concacaf Gold Cup, which would be Palestine's first major international tournament.

headline.seo: For Palestine Soccer, Even Coming Home Is No Given
headline.main: For Palestine, a Final May Be Just the Start
headline.print_headline: For Palestine, a Final May Be Just the Start

docs.lead_paragraph: Palestine's football team won the Asia Challenge Cup on Friday in a match against the Philippines, securing its place in the AFC Asia Cup that will be held next year in Australia.

headline.main: Palestinians Win First International Football Match, Gain Asia Cup Spot
headline.print_headline: Palestinians Win First International Football Match, Gain Asia Cup Spot
